title: Son of the King: An Elvis Paradox Unveiled
description: This biography is the true story of ELVIS the King of Rock n' Roll and his legitimate, illegitimate son. This book explores the relationships of those closest to ELVIS PRESLEY and the influences each of them had that kept ELVIS from claiming his first born John Smith Presley. This ELVIS story is different than any other in that it is the most complete book on ELVIS, including his relationships with his parents Gladys Smith Presley and Vernon Presley. Colonel Tom Parker and his management of ELVIS that eventually led to ELVIS being overworked to exhaustion and turning to prescription medication for rest is frankly written. The Memphis Mafia, the famous backup singers - The Jordanaires and Elvis' favorite singer Sherrill Nielsen are all in this must read book for ELVIS fans.
author: Rico Austin
